instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED..
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL is another way to say SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL, look at the definition provided for SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL as it applies to .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns the cooler for 5 seconds and stops.
threads.message:
Ola amigo, this mac had oxidation in components below the SMC on the other side of the board, replace, in tests the mac turns on the cooler and stops. I checked the <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> signal stays high 3.3V and then it stays 0v. it already replaces the <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>, but I didn't succeed.

Voltage: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>: 12.58V; <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>.
diode scale:
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL</SIGNAL> 0.540V
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA</SIGNAL> 0.538V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns the cooler for 5 seconds and stops.
threads.message: Reball SMC, if detected corrosion close to it...
